snippet: The agreement by ArcelorMittal to drop plans to lay off more than 600 steel workers may carry a high political price for President François Hollande of France.
abstract: French steel company ArcelorMittal agrees to drop plans to lay off more than 600 workers in return for the Socialist government's shelving a threat to nationalize a steel making complex in Florange; deal is seen as politically costly to French Pres Francois Hollande.

byline.original: By STANLEY REED and NICOLA CLARK

lead_paragraph: The agreement by ArcelorMittal to drop plans to lay off more than 600 steel workers may carry a high political price for President François Hollande of France.

headline.print_headline: ArcelorMittal Reaches Deal With French Government to Keep Steel Complex Open
